summary: This bill, the Association Health Plans Act, amends the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 to clarify how groups or associations of employers can be treated as employers for the purposes of establishing and maintaining health plans. It details criteria for these associations, including minimum employee counts, operational longevity, and governance structures. It also addresses the treatment of self-employed individuals and sets rules for premium rates, non-discrimination, and pre-existing condition protections within these plans.
